page.title: 09THE ARMY IN CHELMSFORD
page.content:
{The Territorial Army}is made up of volunteer soldiers who want to serve their country.Volunteers come from all walks of life.The men are trained as combat soldiers and the women for radio,computer or clerical work.
There are two T. A. Regiments which are represented in Chelmsford; these are the{Royal Anglian Regiment}and the{Essex Yeomanry (Signals).
The Royal Anglian T.A. unit has 7 officers and 42 men currently stationed in Chelmsford,with a two acre headquarters site.
The T.A. unit has six, 4-ton gun carriers and several 2-ton Land Rovers for its anti-tank weapons.
